decision_conditions: Retrospective planning permission is granted in accordance with the submitted plans and supporting documents, as follows: 22108-PL001A (Site Location Plan, Existing and Proposed Roof Plan Inc. Schedule); 22108-PL101A (Existing Elevations); 22108-PL102A (Proposed Elevations); Odour Impact Assessment by Aval Consulting Group dated 9th January 2024; Noise Impact Assessment by Aval Consulting Group dated August 2024; Supporting Document "Odour Control modification to extract system SPECIFICATION"; Letter by Aval Consulting Group dated 03 October 2024.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| An effective kitchen extract system and odour control system shall be installed and operated, based on an odour risk assessment (according to 2018 EMAQ Guidance) and be maintained according to the manufacturer's cleaning and maintenance recommendations. The extract duct shall terminate vertically without cowl at least 1m above the eaves of the main building. Equipment and ducting shall be sited with anti-vibration mounts and silencers, to prevent vibration and transmission to noise sensitive receivers via internal building elements and external fa√ßades. The installation and mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to use and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by smell or steam, in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy D5 of the OPDC Local Plan 2018 to 2038 (2022) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| The rating noise level (LAr,Tr) of the individual and combined maximum noise emitted by plant, ducting and equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policies D5 and EU5 of the OPDC Local Plan 2018 to 2038 (2022).

| The machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policies D5 and EU5 of the OPDC Local Plan 2018 to 2038 (2022).
| The use of the premises shall operate only between 7:00am and 5:00pm, Monday to Friday, unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority, through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To protect neighbouring amenities, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and Policies D5 and EU5 of the OPDC Local Plan 2018 to 2038 (2022).
description: Installation of intake / extract penetrations through roof following fit out to food production (retrospective).
